metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8991 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
pip 1.3 through 1.5.6 allows local users to cause a denial of service (prevention of package installation) by creating a /tmp/pip-build-* file for another user.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8991` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pip - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.4
python-pip-whl - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.4
python3-pip - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: msalvatore> The patch from upstream does not resolve the CVE. Backporting this the actual fix for trusty requires invasive changes that will change the command line interface. The issues is first fixed in version 7.0.0 and the changelog mentions it is backwards incompatible.

criterions.comment: python-pip package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.1-2ubuntu0.4').
